page.title: 18Indoor Leisure
page.content: Peterborough people meet in many groups combining social life with self education and entertainment. By day, the unemployed avoid boredom through "STEP" classes; retired "PROBUS" and active "ROTARY" business men meet for luncheon talks; ladies have Fine Arts morning talks and luncheons. Senior Citizens meet in the afternoons, as do retired civil servants and others. Townswomens' Guilds cater for ladies in the afternoons and evenings with activities and speakers. Similarly, Womens' Institutions meet in the villages. Evening choices include Civic interest through the Peter borough Society, Natural History in the Museum Society, Genealogy by Family Historians, national speakers at the Everyman Club, apart from Oddfellows, Druids, Foresters and Masonic Lodges.
